<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/10/softbankbacked-brandless-closes-shop?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Branding 101: Have a Brand
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt='An illustration of a Brandless peanut butter jar with a "not for sale" sticker on it' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxMzcyMTE0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Brandless, a direct-to-consumer retailer, has <a href="https://www.protocol.com/softbank-brandless-shuts-down?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down</a> business operations, Protocol reports. It's laying off 70 employees, while the remaining 10 will look for acquisition offers and fulfill remaining orders.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Brandless launched in July 2017 on the conviction that millennials were just as over conventional "brands" as they were canned tuna. It offered hundreds of everyday household items—from organic maple syrup to tree-free toilet paper—at just $3 a pop.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The rest of Brandless's spiel should sound familiar:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Cut out the hidden middleman to avoid markups</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Offer non-GMO, preservative-free food products</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Advertise "community-driven values" and "transparency"</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Masa Son came knocking</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In July 2018, Brandless announced a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-07-31/brandless-is-battling-amazon-with-240-million-from-softbank?sref=18veDlX6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$240 million investment</a> from SoftBank's Vision Fund that valued the company at over $500 million. SoftBank, a Japanese tech conglomerate led by CEO Masayoshi Son, turned up the heat on a young company that showed promise but struggled with <a href="https://www.vox.com/2018/10/18/17979610/brandless-consumer-packaged-goods-retention?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">customer loyalty</a>, <a href="https://www.theinformation.com/articles/inside-the-turmoil-at-softbank-backed-brandless?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quality control</a>, and inventory management. Execs came and went. New products were sold for $9. It didn't work.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Brandless marks the first time a SoftBank Vision Fund company has closed up shop entirely, though others have pivoted to new business models (Zume) or stopped providing free alcohol (WeWork). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>With the first Vision Fund struggling, SoftBank is finding it difficult to recruit investors for Vision Fund 2. The WSJ reported Friday that the VF2 pool may end up at </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/new-softbank-tech-fund-falls-far-short-of-108-billion-fundraising-goal-11581100669?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">less than half</a></span><span> the $108 billion target. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Also trying to shake things up is Elliott Management, an activist investment firm that </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/06/elliott-ups-stake-softbank-pushes-vision-fund-transparency?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">built up its stake</a></span><span> in SoftBank and is pushing for more transparency.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Amazon, Walmart, and the rest of the retail industry proved too ruthless for a startup whose only brand was repeated mistakes. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEFENSE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/10/amazon-challenges-trump-jedi-contract?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon Moves From "Anger" to "Bargaining"
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When Brady doesn't win a Super Bowl, he goes home and polishes the six rings he's already got. When Amazon doesn't win the Pentagon's $10 billion JEDI contract, it takes it up with the boss's boss's boss's boss.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to court documents unsealed yesterday, Amazon wants President Trump, SecDef Mark Esper, and a handful of other officials to <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/02/10/804480574/amazon-wants-trump-to-testify-about-military-contract-awarded-to-microsoft?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">testify</a> over the awarding of the 10-year cloud computing contract to Microsoft last October.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why Amazon thinks the award was rigged</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a lawsuit, Amazon claims the deal was "based on bias and bad faith." The company says President Trump gave then-SecDef James Mattis <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-jedi-lawmaking/amazon-seeks-to-depose-trump-esper-in-lawsuit-over-cloud-computing-contract-idUSKBN2041TJ?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">orders</a> to "screw Amazon'' out of the contract and abused his authority to carry out a personal vendetta against Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos through the procurement process.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The lawsuit claims Trump has a history of interfering in contracts, including a border wall deal and a bid to move the FBI headquarters. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As a candidate, Trump said Amazon would "have problems" if he was elected. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Amazon is waiting to hear whether a court approves its attempt to block Microsoft from starting work.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
M&A
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/10/monday-busy-day-ma?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We Did Not Plan This: A Busy Day in M&A
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="T-Mobile and Sprint phones connected" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgxMzc5MzYzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We sent the Fortune 500 a PR blast about Merger Week, and they delivered. Let's catch up with the latest in M&A.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">T-Mobile and Sprint: </strong>Today, a federal judge is expected to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/xerox-raises-offer-for-hp-plans-to-launch-takeover-bid-in-early-march-11581342655?mod=business_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wave the green flag</a> on the $26 billion merger between the No. 3 and No. 4 wireless carriers, the WSJ scoops. Following the report, Sprint stock shot up more than 60% in extended trading. <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Simon and Taubman: </strong>You might not remember the last time you went to a mall...which is why Simon Property Group, the largest mall owner in the U.S., will acquire smaller rival Taubman Centers in a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/10/simon-property-group-to-acquire-taubman-centers-for-52point50-a-share-in-cash.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$3.6 billion deal</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The hope is that the retail angel of death will save the nicest stores for last: Both landlords run high-end shopping centers like Taubman's The Mall at Short Hills in NJ. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Xerox and HP: </strong>Xerox makes big printers you yell at at work; HP makes smaller printers you yell at at home. Both their sales are slowing, and yesterday Xerox <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/xerox-raises-offer-for-hp-plans-to-launch-takeover-bid-in-early-march-11581342655?mod=business_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upped its offer</a> to buy HP. A public takeover bid is coming next month, but HP's turned down Xerox before.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Edgewell and Harry's: </strong>Edgewell Personal Care thought a $1.4 billion acquisition of direct-to-consumer razor brand Harry's would give it an edge over P&G in the shaving industry...until the FTC said it would block the deal because of competition concerns. Yesterday, Edgewell <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/10/schick-razor-maker-abandons-bln-deal-for-harrys-after-ftc-opposition.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped the plans</a>.</p>

</a><span>  </span>

</a>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/10/promising-alzheimers-drugs-disappoint-clinical-trials?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Alzheimer's Setback
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An illustration of a stethoscope and a clipboard " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4NTE4MTIzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The uphill climb to treat Alzheimer's disease got even steeper yesterday. Drugs from Eli Lilly and a Roche subsidiary <a href="https://apnews.com/d058a66b5f7bf8d4f44acd690a5cb03a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disappointed</a> in a highly anticipated trial that averaged up to five years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The results were "really crushing," principal investigator Dr. Randall Bateman <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/10/health/alzheimers-amyloid-drug.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the NYT</a>. Neither of the drugs slowed cognitive decline in the 104 trial participants who took medication. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The participants all have a rare genetic mutation that essentially guarantees they'll develop Alzheimer's in their 30s–50s. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>After the trial, Bateman admitted there is no way to treat patients with the mutation. His team doesn't have a quick way to notify the volunteers of the results, either. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Scientists will keep trying. </strong>In October, Biogen shocked the medical community by <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/biogen-shocks-medical-community-reversal-alzheimers-drug?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reviving</a> aducanumab, an Alzheimer's drug it had shelved months earlier. The next step is submitting the treatment for regulatory approval. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> In 2018, Alzheimer's affected about 5.7 million people in the U.S. Current treatments only ease symptoms temporarily; they do not slow memory loss or the deterioration of thinking skills.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Finding true love is hard. Finding true synergies is harder. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When you’re a small company, the universe of potential matches is vast. Some try to make it more manageable by borrowing a strategy from human courtship: dating apps. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On the second day of Merger Week, we’ll walk you through how companies meet—from traditional, dad-approved socializing to seeking out potential matches on algorithmically powered platforms. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/10/swipe-right-merge-companies-find-love?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read it here</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For corporations, coupling up isn't just about Russell Stover chocolates and long-stemmed roses. So to celebrate Merger Week...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Axios Business Editor and author of the Pro Rata newsletter Dan Primack came on the Brew's <em>Business Casual </em>podcast to explain why mergers and acquisitions happen—and why they don't.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LOVE POEMS
</h3>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A scene from Shakespeare in Love " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/eg1T8nY5PzSSs/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A scene from Shakespeare in Love " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/eg1T8nY5PzSSs/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We may be hopeless romantics, but we cannot in good conscience celebrate Merger Week without love poems. So here's what we did: We reimagined three famous M&A deals as love poems. Can you figure out the two companies involved in each deal? </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">1. Haiku</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ll give you glass shoes<br>You can keep your paper planes<br>Pandas and robots </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">2. Sonnet</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Shall I compare thee to a granola bar?<br>Thou art more organic and more sustainable:<br>High prices do shake the darling residents of LA,<br>And in-store shopping’s lease hath all too short a date;<br>Sometime too hot the eye of delivery shines,<br>And often is his customer loyalty dimm'd;<br>And every fair avocado sometime declines,<br>By chance or nature’s changing course untrimm'd;<br>But thy eternal produce shall not fade,<br>Nor lose possession of that cult following;<br>Nor shall Brooklyn stop bragging thou carry local cheese,<br>When in eternal lines to pay thou grow’st:<br>    So long as hipsters can eat or New Yorkers order delivery,<br>    So long lives this merger, and this gives price-cuts to thee.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">3. Limerick </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If everyone were as carefree<br>As us two telco firms with low fees<br>Then the darned DOJ would stay out of our way<br>And we'll finish our quest to 5G</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Want to write your own love poem about a merger?</em> <em><a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/pv3Zer?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Share it here</a>. </em></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBrandless, a direct-to-consumer retailer, has \u003ca href=\"https://www.protocol.com/softbank-brandless-shuts-down?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshut down\u003c/a\u003e business operations, Protocol reports. It's laying off 70 employees, while the remaining 10 will look for acquisition offers and fulfill remaining orders.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eBrandless launched in July 2017 on the conviction that millennials were just as over conventional \"brands\" as they were canned tuna. It offered hundreds of everyday household items—from organic maple syrup to tree-free toilet paper—at just $3 a pop.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe rest of Brandless's spiel should sound familiar:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCut out the hidden middleman to avoid markups\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOffer non-GMO, preservative-free food products\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAdvertise \"community-driven values\" and \"transparency\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMasa Son came knocking\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn July 2018, Brandless announced a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-07-31/brandless-is-battling-amazon-with-240-million-from-softbank?sref=18veDlX6\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$240 million investment\u003c/a\u003e from SoftBank's Vision Fund that valued the company at over $500 million. SoftBank, a Japanese tech conglomerate led by CEO Masayoshi Son, turned up the heat on a young company that showed promise but struggled with \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2018/10/18/17979610/brandless-consumer-packaged-goods-retention?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecustomer loyalty\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/inside-the-turmoil-at-softbank-backed-brandless?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equality control\u003c/a\u003e, and inventory management. Execs came and went. New products were sold for $9. It didn't work.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eBrandless marks the first time a SoftBank Vision Fund company has closed up shop entirely, though others have pivoted to new business models (Zume) or stopped providing free alcohol (WeWork). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWith the first Vision Fund struggling, SoftBank is finding it difficult to recruit investors for Vision Fund 2. The WSJ reported Friday that the VF2 pool may end up at \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/new-softbank-tech-fund-falls-far-short-of-108-billion-fundraising-goal-11581100669?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eless than half\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the $108 billion target. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAlso trying to shake things up is Elliott Management, an activist investment firm that \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/06/elliott-ups-stake-softbank-pushes-vision-fund-transparency?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuilt up its stake\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in SoftBank and is pushing for more transparency.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon, Walmart, and the rest of the retail industry proved too ruthless for a startup whose only brand was repeated style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen Brady doesn't win a Super Bowl, he goes home and polishes the six rings he's already got. When Amazon doesn't win the Pentagon's $10 billion JEDI contract, it takes it up with the boss's boss's boss's boss.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to court documents unsealed yesterday, Amazon wants President Trump, SecDef Mark Esper, and a handful of other officials to \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/02/10/804480574/amazon-wants-trump-to-testify-about-military-contract-awarded-to-microsoft?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etestify\u003c/a\u003e over the awarding of the 10-year cloud computing contract to Microsoft last October.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy Amazon thinks the award was rigged\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a lawsuit, Amazon claims the deal was \"based on bias and bad faith.\" The company says President Trump gave then-SecDef James Mattis \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-jedi-lawmaking/amazon-seeks-to-depose-trump-esper-in-lawsuit-over-cloud-computing-contract-idUSKBN2041TJ?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eorders\u003c/a\u003e to \"screw Amazon'' out of the contract and abused his authority to carry out a personal vendetta against Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos through the procurement process.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe lawsuit claims Trump has a history of interfering in contracts, including a border wall deal and a bid to move the FBI headquarters. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs a candidate, Trump said Amazon would \"have problems\" if he was elected. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe sent the Fortune 500 a PR blast about Merger Week, and they delivered. Let's catch up with the latest in M\u0026A.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eT-Mobile and Sprint: \u003c/strong\u003eToday, a federal judge is expected to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/xerox-raises-offer-for-hp-plans-to-launch-takeover-bid-in-early-march-11581342655?mod=business_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewave the green flag\u003c/a\u003e on the $26 billion merger between the No. 3 and No. 4 wireless carriers, the WSJ scoops. Following the report, Sprint stock shot up more than 60% in extended trading. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSimon and Taubman: \u003c/strong\u003eYou might not remember the last time you went to a mall...which is why Simon Property Group, the largest mall owner in the U.S., will acquire smaller rival Taubman Centers in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/10/simon-property-group-to-acquire-taubman-centers-for-52point50-a-share-in-cash.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$3.6 billion deal\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe hope is that the retail angel of death will save the nicest stores for last: Both landlords run high-end shopping centers like Taubman's The Mall at Short Hills in NJ. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eXerox and HP: \u003c/strong\u003eXerox makes big printers you yell at at work; HP makes smaller printers you yell at at home. Both their sales are slowing, and yesterday Xerox \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/xerox-raises-offer-for-hp-plans-to-launch-takeover-bid-in-early-march-11581342655?mod=business_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eupped its offer\u003c/a\u003e to buy HP. A public takeover bid is coming next month, but HP's turned down Xerox before.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEdgewell and Harry's: \u003c/strong\u003eEdgewell Personal Care thought a $1.4 billion acquisition of direct-to-consumer razor brand Harry's would give it an edge over P\u0026G in the shaving industry...until the FTC said it would block the deal because of competition concerns. Yesterday, Edgewell \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/10/schick-razor-maker-abandons-bln-deal-for-harrys-after-ftc-opposition.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped the plans\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nHEALTHCARE\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAlzheimer's Setback\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"An illustration of a stethoscope and a clipboard \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc4NTE4MTIzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe uphill climb to treat Alzheimer's disease got even steeper yesterday. Drugs from Eli Lilly and a Roche subsidiary \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/d058a66b5f7bf8d4f44acd690a5cb03a?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisappointed\u003c/a\u003e in a highly anticipated trial that averaged up to five years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe results were \"really crushing,\" principal investigator Dr. Randall Bateman \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/10/health/alzheimers-amyloid-drug.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the NYT\u003c/a\u003e. Neither of the drugs slowed cognitive decline in the 104 trial participants who took medication. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe participants all have a rare genetic mutation that essentially guarantees they'll develop Alzheimer's in their 30s–50s. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter the trial, Bateman admitted there is no way to treat patients with the mutation. His team doesn't have a quick way to notify the volunteers of the results, either. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eScientists will keep trying. \u003c/strong\u003eIn October, Biogen shocked the medical community by \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/biogen-shocks-medical-community-reversal-alzheimers-drug?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereviving\u003c/a\u003e aducanumab, an Alzheimer's drug it had shelved months earlier. The next step is submitting the treatment for regulatory approval. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e In 2018, Alzheimer's affected about 5.7 million people in the U.S. Current treatments only ease symptoms temporarily; they do not slow memory loss or the deterioration of thinking skills.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: Sonnet\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eShall I compare thee to a granola bar?\u003cbr\u003eThou art more organic and more sustainable:\u003cbr\u003eHigh prices do shake the darling residents of LA,\u003cbr\u003eAnd in-store shopping’s lease hath all too short a date;\u003cbr\u003eSometime too hot the eye of delivery shines,\u003cbr\u003eAnd often is his customer loyalty dimm'd;\u003cbr\u003eAnd every fair avocado sometime declines,\u003cbr\u003eBy chance or nature’s changing course untrimm'd;\u003cbr\u003eBut thy eternal produce shall not fade,\u003cbr\u003eNor lose possession of that cult following;\u003cbr\u003eNor shall Brooklyn stop bragging thou carry local cheese,\u003cbr\u003eWhen in eternal lines to pay thou grow’st:\u003cbr\u003e    So long as hipsters can eat or New Yorkers order delivery,\u003cbr\u003e    So long lives this merger, and this gives price-cuts to thee.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e3.
